feed.title: Your awesome title
feed.subtitle: Write an awesome description for your new site here. You can edit this line in _config.yml. It will appear in your document head meta (for Google search results) and in your feed.xml site description.

entry.title: Sustained Space and Cumulative Complexity Trade-offs for Data-Dependent Memory-Hard Functions

link.title: Sustained Space and Cumulative Complexity Trade-offs for Data-Dependent Memory-Hard Functions

entry.title: Watch Where You’re Going! Gaze and Head Orientation as Predictors for Social Robot Navigation

link.title: Watch Where You’re Going! Gaze and Head Orientation as Predictors for Social Robot Navigation

entry.content: Leverage virtual reality to collect gaze and position data to create a predictive model and a mixed effects model to show gaze orientation precedes other features
entry.summary: Leverage virtual reality to collect gaze and position data to create a predictive model and a mixed effects model to show gaze orientation precedes other features

entry.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
entry.content:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

Jekyll requires blog post files to be named according to the following format:

YEAR-MONTH-DAY-title.MARKUP

Where YEAR is a four-digit number, MONTH and DAY are both two-digit numbers, and MARKUP is the file extension representing the format used in the file. After that, include the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll Talk.
entry.summary: You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

entry.title: Popularity in Three-Dimensional Stable Marriage
entry.content: Proved the hardness of problems related to popularity in Three-Dimensional Stable marriage, gave structural results for the relationship between popularity and stability, and gave two graph theoretic problems that are equivalent to popularity testing.
entry.summary: Proved the hardness of problems related to popularity in Three-Dimensional Stable marriage, gave structural results for the relationship between popularity and stability, and gave two graph theoretic problems that are equivalent to popularity testing.

entry.title: Using Human-Inspired Signals to Disambiguate Navigational Intentions

link.title: Using Human-Inspired Signals to Disambiguate Navigational Intentions

entry.content: Specific navigational cues are used to study how users interact with various signals on our BWIBots in a hallway scenario.
entry.summary: Specific navigational cues are used to study how users interact with various signals on our BWIBots in a hallway scenario.

entry.title: The Relationship Between Three-Sided Popularity and Stability

link.title: The Relationship Between Three-Sided Popularity and Stability

entry.content: Showed the structural relationship between popularity and stability in Three-Dimensional Stable Marriage in contrast to the two-sided case.
entry.summary: Showed the structural relationship between popularity and stability in Three-Dimensional Stable Marriage in contrast to the two-sided case.

entry.title: The Hardness of Popularity in Three-Dimensional Stable Marriage

link.title: The Hardness of Popularity in Three-Dimensional Stable Marriage

entry.content: Showed that deciding whether an instance of Three-Dimensional Stable Marriage with Ties admits a popular matching is NP-hard.
entry.summary: Showed that deciding whether an instance of Three-Dimensional Stable Marriage with Ties admits a popular matching is NP-hard.

entry.title: Active Tracking and Re-Identification for Mobile Robot Person Following

link.title: Active Tracking and Re-Identification for Mobile Robot Person Following

entry.content: Used the Triple-loss metric for person following and reidentification.
entry.summary: Used the Triple-loss metric for person following and reidentification.
